2025 BTC$BTC  Marked a Turning Point for Crypto Derivatives - CoinGlass   According to CoinGlass, the crypto derivatives market in 2025 shifted from retail-driven speculation to an institutional model, powered by ETFs, regulated infrastructure, and on-chain technologies.   Institutional capital became the dominant market driver   CME strengthened its leadership in BTC$BTC  derivatives and nearly matched CEX volumes in Ethereum   Bitcoin acted less as an inflation hedge and more as a high-risk asset with amplified market sensitivity   October saw the largest liquidation event ever, with over $19B liquidated in one day   Total derivatives trading volume reached $85.7T, with heavy concentration on top venues   DeFi perpetual DEXs and Web3 wallets scaled to a new level   Bottom line: The market is more mature and institutional - but systemic risks from leverage and liquidity concentration remain, and will likely be the key challenge in 2026.   #BTC Price Analysis#  #Bitcoin

The Quiet Email That Broke the Old Financial World  No press release. No VC backing. No influencers. Just one email, sent in October 2008, while banks were collapsing and trust in money was evaporating - by Satoshi Nakamoto.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been working on a new electronic cash system that‚Äôs fully peer-to-peer, with no trusted third party.‚Äù  That line declared independence. Independence from banks freezing accounts. From governments debasing currency. From intermediaries deciding who gets access to money and who doesn‚Äôt. It wasn‚Äôt about price. It was about power.  The brilliance wasn‚Äôt just the technology. It was the timing. $BTC  was born as a direct response to systemic failure, a monetary system designed to function precisely when institutions don‚Äôt. Proof-of-work wasn‚Äôt an efficiency choice; it was a security guarantee. The longest chain wasn‚Äôt just data, it was history you couldn‚Äôt rewrite.  Sixteen years later, trillions of dollars, nation-states, ETFs, miners, critics, and believers all orbit that same PDF attached to a modest email. No founder interviews. No exit. No control. And that‚Äôs exactly why it worked.  Every bull market comes and goes. Every narrative evolves. But this email? It activated a new era.  This wasn‚Äôt the start of #Bitcoin . This was the moment money stopped asking for permission.  What do you think matters more today? the price, or the principle that started it all?  #BTC Price Analysis#  #Bitcoin Price Prediction: What is Bitcoins next move?#

Expert Outlines Key Crypto Market Trends for 2026

Pantera Capital junior partner Jay Yu has shared his outlook on how the crypto  $BTC industry may evolve in 2026, highlighting several themes he believes will shape the next market cycle.

Among the main drivers, Yu points to continued growth in real-world assets (RWA), the rise of agent-based commerce, and the transformation of Al into a primary interface for crypto applications. He also emphasizes the expanding role of stablecoins in international settlements and cross-border payments.

At the same time, Yu flags several risks to watch. These include a potential "quantum panic" around Bitcoin, upcoming consolidation among crypto exchanges, and a widening gap between tokens and equity-like instruments that do not grant investors legal rights to the underlying businesses.

3 Reasons Why Bitcoin Halving Occurs

Bitcoin halving is a pre-programmed event in the Bitcoin network, where the amount of  $BTC miners receive for validating transactions and adding new blocks to the blockchain is cut in half.

Here are 3 reasons why the Bitcoin halving is important:

1/ Inflation Prevention: By slowing down how many new bitcoins enter circulation, Bitcoin's inflation is prevented.

2/ Ensuring Scarcity: Since only 21 million bitcoins will ever exist, halving makes sure they are released gradually.

3/ Supporting Value: With fewer new bitcoins created, the limited supply helps maintain or increase Bitcoin's price if demand stays the same or grows.
